intro: Arthratherum kotschyi, commonly known as the Persian grass or Kotschyi's grass, is a perennial grass species native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny flowers. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions and can thrive in poor soil conditions. Arthratherum kotschyi is often used in landscaping for its hardy nature and ability to stabilize soil in erosion-prone areas.
